titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Smithsonian Institution Archives

origination.label: Creator:
origination.persname: National Portrait Gallery, Office of Exhibitions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smithsonian Institution Archives, Accession 98-139, National Portrait Gallery, Office of Exhibitions, Exhibition Records

scopecontent.head: Descriptive Entry
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of records pertaining to the planning and development of nine exhibitions ("Blessed Are the Peacemakers;" "U.S. Grant: The Man and the Image;" "Portraits by Brady: Imperial Photographs from the Harvard College Library;" "Noble Heritage: Five Centuries of Portraits from the Hosokawa Family;" "The Spirit of the Party: Hamilton and Jefferson at Odds;" "In Pursuit of Fame: Rembrandt Peale, 1778-1860;" "White City: American Art at the 1893 World Fair;" "From Elizabeth I to Elizabeth II: Master Drawings from the National Portrait Gallery, London;" and "Contemporary Self-Portraits from the James Goode Collection"). Materials include checklists, scripts, labels, loan agreements, correspondence, memoranda, lender sheets, funding and budget information, photographs, and research notes.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restriction
accessrestrict.p: Box 8 contains materials restricted indefinitely; see finding aid. Contact reference staff for details.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following access terms. These are links to collections with related topics, persons or places.

controlaccess.head: Name
controlaccess.famname: American Art at the 1893 World's Fair (Exhibition) (1993: Washington, D.C.)
Blessed Are the Peacemakers (Exhibition) (1983: Washington, D.C.)
Contemporary Self-Portraits from the James Goode Collection (Exhibition) (1993: Washington, D.C.)
From Elizabeth I to Elizabeth II: Master Drawings from the National Portrait Gallery, London (Exhibition) (1994: Washington, D.C.)
In Pursuit of Fame: Rembrandt Peale, 1778-1860 (Exhibition) (1992-1993: Washington, D.C.)
Noble Heritage: Five Centuries of Portraiture from the Hosokawa Family (Exhibition) (1992: Washington, D.C.)
Portraits by Brady: Imperial Photographs from the Harvard College Library (Exhibition) (1986: Washington, D.C.)
Spirit of the Party: Hamilton and Jefferson at Odds (Exhibition) (1992: Washington, D.C.)
U.S. Grant: The Man and the Image (Exhibition) (1985: Washington, D.C.)
